revised_title: Air Turbulence Measurements and Atmospheric Stability Categories in Urban Areas
tldr: This study investigates air turbulence measurements in Reading and their relation to Turner's stability categories. The authors found that eliminating the high-frequency band of turbulence measurements distinguishes stable categories from neutral ones. The results have implications for calculating the dispersion of pollution from chimneys in urban areas.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Meteorology and Climatology
